output.name: air
output.description: This repository provides mappings for axis directions (X: left-right, Y: back-front, Z: down-up) with identifier codes.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Exact match from Infoscience authors search for 'Petras Vestartas'.

entity.title: Design-to-Fabrication Workflow for Raw-Sawn-Timber using Joinery Solver
entity.abstract: Currently, the Swiss timber industry in mountain areas largely exports unprocessed lumber and imports finished timber products due to the lack of digital tools. By using new digital design-to-production workflows, it is possible to investigate new building systems for small-scale structures using local resources.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Publication listed under Petras Vestartas in Infoscience author publications.

entity.title: Robotic Timber Construction
entity.publication_type: text::conference output::conference poster not in proceedings

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Conference poster co-authored by Petras Vestartas from author publications list.

entity.title: Laser Scanning with Industrial Robot Arm for Raw-wood Fabrication
entity.abstract: This paper presents an integrated raw-wood fabrication workflow using an industrial robot arm and a laser scanner. The research is situated in a Swiss mountain forestry context where timber in its natural form could be applied locally without relying on large centralized timber industries. While local material flows reduce transport and processing energy, automation remains challenging for natural stock.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Conference paper co-authored by Petras Vestartas from Infoscience author publications.

entity.title: Joinery Solver for Whole Timber Structures
entity.abstract: This paper presents a digital joinery generation method for whole-timber structures using wood-wood connections. The research is based on a collaboration with a local timber company located in a mountain area. In this context, there is a need to explore available round-wood stock to increase its structural potential.
entity.publication_type: text::conference output::conference paper not in proceedings

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Conference output co-authored by Petras Vestartas from author publications list.

entity.title: Structural design methodology in Integrally-Attached Timber Plate structures
entity.abstract: The immediate application of research discoveries requires a global and exact understanding of the structure under consideration. To gain insight into the complex behavior of structures, numerical simulations are carried out in parallel to physical experiments and digital fabrication, computer-aided design programming.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Book chapter co-authored by Petras Vestartas retrieved from author publications.

entity.title: Parametric Workshop
entity.abstract: This bi-annual workshop is an introduction to parametric design for Master 1 students following Studio Weinand. The following topics are being discussed: impact of digital technologies on the design process, fabrication and assembly constraints, collaborative workflows, geometry fundamentals, constraint-based modeling.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Teaching material listed under Petras Vestartas' publications.

entity.title: Robotically-Fabricated Nexorades from Whole Timber
entity.abstract: This paper introduces the conceptual design of sustainable timber structures using raw wood. It presents a workflow for systematically generating Nexorades using a tiling method for multi-valence quad subdivided surfaces. The system is designed based on an integrated framework combining resources and digital fabrication techniques.
entity.publication_type: text::conference output::conference paper not in proceedings

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Conference paper co-authored by Petras Vestartas from author publications list.

entity.title: Design framework for the structural analysis of free-form timber plate structures using wood-wood connections
entity.abstract: Geometrically complex timber plate structures using wood-wood connections are increasingly designed thanks to digital fabrication. Whereas their fabrication has been automated using computer-aided design programming, research focused on the development of automated numerical tools for their structural analysis.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Journal article co-authored by Petras Vestartas from author publications.

entity.title: Modelling Workflow for Segmented Timber Shells using Wood-wood Connections.
entity.abstract: This paper presents a modelling method based on planarization for double-curved segmented timber shell made from quad polygons and assembled by wood-wood connections. The inspiration is taken from timber dome structures, where solid timber walls were built from planks, connected side by side. Further developments include geometry optimization for planar panels.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Conference presentation co-authored by Petras Vestartas from author publications list.
